page.title: 08 HAMBLETON C.E. SCHOOL
page.content: In 1872 the old school in Station Road was built, consisting of a small infants class and a large room which became 2 classes divided by a sliding screen.It was used for schooling on weekdays but for church sevices on Sundays.At first it had 48 pupils but that rose to 150. However it became over crowded,so it moved in September 1973.The new school was built in Gateforth Lane and is still in use.This was an improvement as the school houses 183 children in 6 classes and each has 2 toilets.It has a hall which turns into a gymnasium.Its low windows light the room and provide a view of the Hough.We have a colour T.V,computer and video and many other resources.Yet perhaps it will seem primitive in many hundreds of years.
